name: Hotel Viura

reviews.title: Brilliant and unique hotel
reviews.text: Spent two nights in this visually stunning hotel. Overall service was very good and the quality of the room excellent. Being isolated, If you don't want to drive to go out for dinner you have little option but to eat at the restaurant, but we found the food here to be delicious, lobe it slightly on the expensive side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as part of our tour of the Bodegas of La Rioja. The welcome was very good, there are always staff available to help, we were upgraded to a room with a balcony on the second floor which was most appreciated. The bedroom itself was clean and contemporary and the bed was lovely.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are superb, great selection and really fresh produce.
reviews.title: Very special hotel

reviews.text: There are plenty of different spaces within the hotel to relax in peace and quiet and we will definitely return in the future.
reviews.title: Excellent Rioja hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town itself is very quiet but you are within 5 minutes drive of other villages with great places to eat and drink and who can complain with 33 vineyards in a village of only 300 inhabitants!
reviews.title: Relaxing base for Rioja exploration

reviews.text: After stops in Bilbao and San Sebastian, the Hubby and I headed out to the Rioja countryside and to the Hotel Viura. As you arrive, you marvel at the exterior but, it certainly doesn’t look out of place in its setting. We absolutely loved the industrial styling of the hotel but it was still welcoming and comfy and the service, from the reception staff to the waiters was efficient but relaxed and incredibly friendly.
reviews.title: A design gem of a hotel set in a lovely traditional village
thank you Sunday Times "Where was I?"
reviews.text: We had a deluxe room (No# 205) and were lucky to get one with a balcony that overlooked the village swimming pool. We took breakfast on our balcony (I love a place that doesn’t charge extra for room service) and dinner one night as the weather was glorious. Our room was incredibly spacious with a huge bed, sofa; it was all concert and sleek lines and really groovy.
The roof terrace was an added bonus - it got a lovely breeze and there were plenty of nooks and crannies to relax and snooze.
reviews.title: Customer service above and beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our first night there we went to the bar for a drink and the bar tender knocked up a fabulous G&T with crushed juniper berries - a real masterpiece! We dined in the restaurant and although we were 1 of only 3 couple dining there, as the place is so relaxed it’s didn’t feel awkward. The food was really good. Taking a relaxed dinner in our room the second night was a nice alternative and a chance to try some wine we’d picked up that day whilst out visiting the local villages.
reviews.title: Perfect for wine-lovers keen to explore Rioja
Nice hotel
reviews.text: We also went to the Marques de Riscal for lunch one day (the Bistro). This is a must as the hotel is stunning. Again, great service and food and I’ve never been anywhere that gave my hand bag its own little table so I didn’t have to put it on the floor! Plus, red toilet rolls were also a first! We really enjoyed lunch there but, preferred to stay at the Hotel Viura which is a really great place to spend a few days chilling out - highly recommended.
Adjectives do not describe Hotel Viura! Outstanding, enchanting, luxe, cutting-edge.
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.text: Located in the tiny little village of Villabeuna in the gorgeous La Rioja wine region, the hotel itself is art. You may come to visit the Marques de Riscal, but you really must retreat to the Viura if you love contemporary architecture and design hotels.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.text: With industrial touches like glass showers, minimalist furnishings and concrete flooring combined with more homey elements like wood, plants and local art, the hotel manages to be visually stunning and yet both accessible and comfortable. I loved the edgy chalk-mark room signs and the chain link stairwell set off against the luxurious open areas and stunning views of the rural village.
reviews.title: A gem!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My suite was absolutely luxurious - concrete floors, lush carpet, gorgeous linens, unbelievable views. The patio outside my room, as well as the rooftop patio with sweeping views, were nothing short of incredible.
reviews.title: Uber-Modern

reviews.text: The bathrooms are spacious, complimentary wireless connection and every amenity you can dream of. The bed and linens were beyond comfortable.
reviews.title: An experience that you wont forget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A true gem. The hotel is a very fashionable piece of modern arquitechture, in the middle of an old spanish village. Rooms are wide and spacious, and decoration has a taste of the wine culture. As the only con, we missed a little of attention on arrival, someone to take care and bring our baggages to the room.
reviews.title: a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During the summer we spent a few days in the Rioja Alavesa region and searched for a different but luxurious hotel. We found Viura and had a few very good days there.
reviews.title: Fantastic, very modern hotel in the middle of an old village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: The hotel is situated next to the village church and square in Villabuena. It is a great location for exploring the wine region. The village is also interesting because it is said that it has the highest density of bodegas compared with how many inhabitants...
reviews.title: Brilliant ultra-modern hotel
One of the more visually arresting hotels you will ever see
reviews.text: Reception: Very kind and helpful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Big and spacious, simple style, built with concrete. Maybe not everyones's taste, but I loved it!
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels ever...

aka: Hotel Viura Spain/Villabuena De Alava, Alava
description: Composed of whimsically superimposed cubes that seem to surge forcefully from the centre of the earth; punctuated by French windows that flood the rooms with views of the relaxing scenery. Situated in Villabuena de Álava in the Rioja Alavesa, Viura is perfect as a base for discovering La Rioja. Only 20 minutes away from Logroño and from Haro and 10 minutes from such emblematic wine cellars as Ysios and Marqués de Riscal. In addition to its magnificent restaurant, the bar, a fine old wine cellar and a gymnasium, Viura has wonderful terraces on the top floor with panoramic views of the San Andrés Church, built between 1538 and 1728, and of all the mountains of the Sierra de Cantabria. All hotel guests have at their disposal, without any charge, wireless internet connection, soft drinks from the mini-bar, gym access, bicycles and parking. The hotel also offers dvd players and a wide range of movies on DVD, for free.
